frameDefinitions: A Cook applies heat to Food, where the Temperature_setting of the heat and Duration of application may be specified.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   '
A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
This frame is concerned with Cognizers remembering and forgetting mental Content.
This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
frameExamples: She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.
This role identifes the entity that  directly supplies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Food</fen> is the entity to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the <fen>Heating_instrument</fen> for the <fen>Food</fen>.
The <fen>Container</fen> holds the <fen>Food</fen> to which heat is applied.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the heat application occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application  occurs.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose mental <fen>Content</fen> is at issue.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the mental content that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains or forgets.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject the <fen>Cognizer</fen> mental <fen>Content</fen> is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the remembering or forgetting of mental <fen>Content</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the remembering or forgetting takes place.
The <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

<fen>Phenomenon</fen> indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
<fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen>, typically expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.

<fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> (which would be marked <fen>Location_of_perceiver</fen>)
When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Drew</fex> sauteed the garlic in butter.
Jim browned the roast <fex>in the oven</fex>.
Suzy usually steams <fex>the broccoli</fex>.
He baked the cookies <fex>at 350 degrees</fex> for 11 minutes.
Boil the potatoes <fex>in a medium-sized pan</fex>.
Jim roasted the chestnuts <fex>in the evening</fex>.
We baked the cake <fex>in the kitchen</fex>.
<fex>Fred</fex> crawled the narrow passage.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
The scouts hiked <fex>through the desert</fex>.
The children skipped <fex>into the park</fex>.
The mouse scurried <fex>about</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
<fex>Nobody</fex> seems to be able to get the idea through to her that she needs a job!!!!

According to Masztalics, a good teacher uses experiments to get the point across
<fex>to the class</fex>.
He tried to get through to his wife <fex>that the debt he's taken on buying stocks poses no risk</fex>.
<fex>The article</fex> conveys Mr. Handley's disrespect for those who disagree with him.
Greenspan got his point across <fex>yesterday</fex> that a measured pace of rate hikes is still the plan.
I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
Each student must be able to recall <fex>the whole paragraph</fex>  .
John forgot everything <fex>about his uncle</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> smelled the milk to see if it was fresh.
The waiter smelled <fex>the milk</fex> to see if it was fresh.
You should feel the water <fex>with your toes</fex> before jumping in.
The detective looked <fex>across the street</fex> at the suspect.
